definition: move (in chess, on stage, in martial arts)/gambit/trick/scheme/movement/same as 招數|招数[zhao1 shu4]
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress
to count/to count as/to regard as/to enumerate (sb's shortcomings)

sentences.english: She can count up to one hundred and backward.
sentences.chinese: 她能数到一百然后再倒着数回来。

sentences.english: Today it connects billions of devices and billions of people.
sentences.chinese: 现在，它连接着数以万亿的设备和人们。

sentences.english: Don't count your chickens before they are hatched .
sentences.chinese: 小鸡还没孵出来，先别忙着数有几只。

sentences.english: Bon't count your chickens before they are hatched.
sentences.chinese: 小鸡还没孵出来，先别忙着数有几只。

definition: more than ten/a dozen or more
hundreds/a large number/lit. by the hundreds and thousands
numerous and close together/densely packed/thickly dotted/thick/dense
lit. by the thousands and tens of thousands (idiom); untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands
over ten thousand/fig. untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands
see 密密麻麻|密密麻麻[mi4 mi5 ma2 ma2]
